Location.LocationDescription: From Features to Outcomes: Understanding the Key to Successful Project Management
Location.LocationBody:
As a project manager, it's easy to get caught up in the latest and greatest features and technologies that promise to revolutionize the way you work. But the truth is, not all features are created equal and not all new technologies are worth your time and attention. To be a truly successful project manager, you need to focus on outcomes, not just features.

So, what exactly are outcomes? Outcomes are the results you want to achieve with your projects. They're the things that matter to your business, such as increased efficiency, improved customer satisfaction, or increased revenue. Outcomes are what drive your projects forward and what ultimately determine their success or failure.

To understand the key to successful project management, you need to shift your focus from features to outcomes. Instead of thinking about what technology or features you need to implement, think about what you want to achieve with your projects. Once you have a clear understanding of your desired outcomes, you can then determine the best way to achieve them, whether that means investing in new technology, improving existing processes, or focusing on customer service.

At Control Origins, we believe that the key to successful project management is understanding the basics or "Project Mechanics". Our co-founder, Mark Hazleton, has developed a comprehensive set of project mechanics that can help you focus on outcomes and avoid getting sidetracked by sizzle. You can learn more about the Project Mechanics by visiting pm.controlorigins.com.

In conclusion, to be a successful project manager, you need to focus on outcomes, not just features. By shifting your focus from technology to results, you can make better decisions, achieve your goals, and deliver real value to your business. Remember, it's not about the latest and greatest technology or features, it's about what you want to achieve with your projects and how you can best achieve those outcomes.
Location.LocationSummary: From Features to Outcomes: Understanding the Key to Successful Project Management

LocationTrail.Name: From Features to Outcomes
LocationTrail.Description: From Features to Outcomes: Understanding the Key to Successful Project Management

Location.LocationDescription: Welcome to the newest Control Origins blog, "Sidetracked by Sizzle"!
Location.LocationBody:
Welcome to Sidetracked By Sizzle

As Control Origins' CEO Mark Hazleton says, "Project managers are constantly bombarded with flashy new features and the latest technologies. It's easy to get sidetracked by all the sizzle, but the key is to stay focused on what will deliver the most value to your business."

That's why we've created "Sidetracked by Sizzle" - a blog that helps project managers stay focused on delivering the most value in their projects. Here, we'll be exploring ways to stay on track and make sure that your projects are successful.
Location.LocationSummary: Welcome to the newest Control Origins blog, "Sidetracked by Sizzle"!

LocationTrail.Name: Welcome to Sidetracked By Sizzle
LocationTrail.Description: Welcome to the newest Control Origins blog, "Sidetracked by Sizzle"!

Location.LocationBody:
As a business leader, it's important to understand the difference between what adds real value to your business and what is simply a distraction. In today's fast-paced and constantly changing technology landscape, it's easy to get sidetracked by the latest and greatest "sizzle" that promises to revolutionize the way you do business. But the truth is, not all technology is created equal and not all new features are worth your time and attention.

So, what does business value really mean? At its core, the business value is about adding something that makes your business better. This could be in the form of improved efficiency, increased revenue, better customer satisfaction, or anything else that helps your business succeed. It's not about the latest technology or features, but about how those features can help your business achieve its goals.

To determine what business value really means for your business, you need to define what your business does. What are your goals? What are your pain points? What are your strengths? Once you have a clear understanding of these things, you can then determine the best way to add value to your business. This might involve investing in new technology or features, but it also might involve improving existing processes or focusing on customer service.

The key is to avoid getting sidetracked by sizzle that doesn't deliver real value. Instead, focus on what your business needs to succeed and make decisions based on that. Don't waste time and resources on features or technologies that don't help you achieve your goals. Instead, put your efforts into what really matters.

In conclusion, the business value is about adding something that makes your business better. It's not about the latest technology or features, but about how those features can help your business achieve its goals. By defining what your business does and what it needs to succeed, you can determine the best way to add value to your business and avoid getting sidetracked by sizzle that doesn't deliver.

Location.LocationDescription: Why Less is More: The Benefits of a Minimalistic Approach to Technology
Location.LocationBody:
In today's fast-paced and constantly changing technology landscape, it's easy to get caught up in the latest and greatest technologies and features that promise to revolutionize the way you do business. But the truth is, not all technology is created equal and not all new features are worth your time and attention. That's why, at Control Origins, we believe that a minimalistic approach to technology is often the best approach.

As co-founder Mark Hazleton says, "Finding the right technology is a complex business decision that takes into account your current application portfolio, team skills and aptitudes, and operation costs." In other words, it's about finding the technology that best fits your needs, not just the technology that everyone else is using.

There are several benefits to a minimalistic approach to technology. First and foremost, it helps you focus on what's important. When you have too many technologies or features to manage, it can be difficult to keep track of what's actually delivering value to your business. By simplifying your technology portfolio, you can focus on what really matters and avoid getting sidetracked by sizzle that doesn't deliver real value.

Second, a minimalistic approach to technology can help you save money. When you have too many technologies or features, it can be difficult to manage the associated costs. You may be paying for features that you don't use or that don't deliver value to your business. By simplifying your technology portfolio, you can reduce costs and allocate more resources to the things that matter.

Finally, a minimalistic approach to technology can help you stay agile. With too many technologies or features, it can be difficult to respond to changes in your business environment. By simplifying your technology portfolio, you can be more responsive to changes and make better decisions about what technologies and features you really need.

In conclusion, a minimalistic approach to technology can help you focus on what's important, save money, and stay agile. By taking a minimalistic approach, you can avoid getting sidetracked by sizzle that doesn't deliver real value and focus on the technology that best fits your needs.
Location.LocationSummary: Why Less is More: The Benefits of a Minimalistic Approach to Technology

LocationTrail.Name: Why Less is More
LocationTrail.Description: Why Less is More: The Benefits of a Minimalistic Approach to Technology
